intro: Hypenia brachystachys, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed hypenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
